page.title: 01MOSSLEY
page.content: A town of approximately 10,000 inhabitants, Mossley is situated in the {Tame Valley }on the edge of the Pennine Range. Mossley grew as a small village in connection with hill farming & the domestic woollen industry in the area around St.Georges Church. Rapid growth began with the Industrial Revolution and the development of the cotton industry and as a result roads, railways, a canal, factories and terraced housing developed along the valley bottom. Mossley had a unique geographical position being situated in three counties but developed the typical characteristics of a Lancashire cotton town.
